channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Offensive political grafitti, 21st July
item.description:
Offensive political grafitti on the bus shelter on Tollington Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tollington Road, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 96 Great Titchfield street W1 , bags out all day for First mile, 21st July
item.description:
This company TASK PR should not be allowed leave bags out all day for collection by private contractors first mile . They should get first get first mile mobile unit to collect with a couple of hours , residents should not have to be subjected to this ongoing issue when restrictions are put on when residential rubbish can be left out . Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Riding House Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsecure drain on grass area, 21st July
item.description:
On the grass area in front of Chilham House is a large size drain, but the drain covering is not secure or in place properly, it is a hazard for an animal or small child to fall down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rollins Street, New Cross Gate, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The bushes and Grass etc are overgrown, 21st July
item.description:
I have put South Bermondsey Station post code, but it is for the area behind the station that is the pedestrian walkway and cycle route. I do not know the exact post code for this cycle route but the tress/shrubs and bushes are all becoming overgrown making it difficult for both people to walk and cyclists, it also has limited street lighting so would be nice if they can be trimmed back to makw it easy for both people and cyclists to pass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned (vandalised?) Lime bike, 21st July
item.description:
In trees just off the R of the wide path from the Hayes Lane car park, before the second pavilion. Appears to have had parts removed, no number visible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bromley Common, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The grille is still blocked, 21st July
item.description:
As you can see the leaf debris has been removed, however the drain is still blocked by mud that is stuck in the grille. The road will still flood when heavy rain occurs. Please, please fix this. Someone needs to get out of a vehicle remove the grille and clear the holes. The grille is located in Hayes Lane j/w Westmoreland Road. On the other side of the road there is at least three grilles between Barnfield Wood Road and Top Park with mud stuck in them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deteriorated pavement, 21st July
item.description:
Hello, I would like to report the deteriorating condition of the pavement outside my neighbour and my property (23/25 Archer Road, BR5 2BS). Is this something the council can resolve? Or can my neighbour and I get the work completed using a contractor? Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Archer Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Asb vandalising garden, 21st July

item.title: Waste collection, 21st July
item.description:
The bins outside danson grammar school require frequent clearing. All three are over flowing from the weekend… again. Might also be an idea to implement bins on the other side of the footpath, outside the primary school. Frequently I litter pick down that road and know how bad it gets.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merlin Road, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
